required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Improving Health Awareness Using Social Network Interventions
clinical_study.official_title: Improving Health Awareness Using Social Network Interventions

brief_summary.textblock: The overarching hypothesis of our study is that social network interventions using artificial intelligence and social media can be used to increase population awareness about health issues. The overarching objective is to improve population awareness on multiple relevant health issues using social network interventions (SNI) and estimate the effect by conducting randomized control trials. Increase population awareness about organ donation in California, especially among minorities

detailed_description.textblock: The population of California will be stratified into demographic environments which are groups of ZIP Codes of similar cultural, socioeconomic, and ethnic/racial factors. Digital markers of population awareness about organ donation will be estimated from publicly available online conversations of users in social media. A clustered randomized control trial will be conducted and ZIP Codes from each demographic environment will be randomly assigned to control and intervention arms. Digital educational materials about organ donation will be exposed to online users in social media belonging to ZIP Codes assigned to the intervention arm.

primary_outcome.measure: Change the number of organ donor registration
primary_outcome.description: Measures: number of registrations at Donate Life web page.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change population awareness about health issues
secondary_outcome.description: Measures: number of clicks and impressions on the ad.

intervention.intervention_name: Digital Sensors for Population Awareness about Health Issues using Social Media
intervention.description: A clustered randomized control trial will be conducted and ZIP Codes from each demographic environment will be randomly assigned to control and intervention arms. Digital educational materials about organ donation will be exposed to online users in social media belonging to ZIP Codes assigned to the intervention arm

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Have a California zip code.
- Be a Facebook user
